title: Jon Connolly
text:
Jon Connolly (born 3 April 1981) is a Scottish <a href="Association%20football">football</a> <a href="Goalkeeper%20%28association%20football%29">goalkeeper</a> and is currently the goalkeeping coach at <a href="Annan%20Athletic%20F.C.">Annan Athletic</a>. Connolly has previously played in the <a href="Scottish%20Premier%20League">Scottish Premier League</a> for <a href="Motherwell%20F.C.">Motherwell</a>.
Career.
Connolly began his senior career in the Academy system at <a href="Ipswich%20Town%20F.C.">Ipswich Town</a> but returned to Scotland to sign for <a href="Albion%20Rovers%20F.C.">Albion Rovers</a> in February 1998, making eight league appearances in the <a href="Scottish%20Football%20League%20Third%20Division">Scottish Football League Third Division</a> before the end of the season. After leaving Rovers, he dropped to <a href="Scottish%20Junior%20Football%20Association">Junior</a> level with <a href="Thorniewood%20United%20F.C.">Thorniewood United</a> before being signed by manager <a href="Billy%20Davies">Billy Davies</a> for <a href="Motherwell%20F.C.">Motherwell</a> in the summer of 2000.
With Motherwell releasing a number of high-earning first team players including <a href="Andy%20Goram">Andy Goram</a>, Connolly found himself as second choice keeper at Fir Park behind <a href="Stevie%20Woods%20%28footballer%29">Stevie Woods</a>. He made his <a href="Scottish%20Premier%20League">Scottish Premier League</a> debut in April 2001 against <a href="Dundee%20United%20F.C.">Dundee United</a> at Tannadice and retained his place in the team for the following weeks match against <a href="Aberdeen%20F.C.">Aberdeen</a>.
These proved to be his only first team appearances for Motherwell and Connolly left the club on the eve of the January 2002 transfer window, signing for <a href="Dumbarton%20F.C.">Dumbarton</a> until the end of the season. A year at <a href="Cumnock%20Juniors%20F.C.">Cumnock Juniors</a> was followed by another <a href="Scottish%20Football%20League">Scottish Football League</a> spell with <a href="East%20Stirlingshire%20F.C.">East Stirlingshire</a> in 2003–04 where he made nineteen league appearances.
After leaving Shire, Connolly has enjoyed a peripatetic career in Junior football. In recent years, he joined <a href="Kilwinning%20Rangers%20F.C.">Kilwinning Rangers</a> in May 2013 before moving on to <a href="Kirkintilloch%20Rob%20Roy%20F.C.">Kirkintilloch Rob Roy</a> in January 2014. Connolly signed for <a href="Vale%20of%20Clyde%20F.C.">Vale of Clyde</a> in the summer of 2014 and had short stints at <a href="Rossvale%20F.C.">Rossvale</a> and <a href="St%20Anthony%27s%20F.C.">St. Anthony's</a> before joining <a href="Scottish%20Junior%20Football%20East%20Region%20Super%20League">East Superleague</a> side <a href="Fauldhouse%20United%20F.C.">Fauldhouse United</a> in October 2016.
Connolly was appointed as player-manager of Fauldhouse in February 2017.
